thread.title: Man Tries to Rape Woman After Following Her Into LES Building, Police Say
thread.title_full: Man Tries to Rape Woman After Following Her Into LES Building, Police Say

title: Man Tries to Rape Woman After Following Her Into LES Building, Police Say
text:
Man Tries to Rape Woman After Following Her Into LES Building, Police Say By Ben Fractenberg | March 3, 2017 6:43pm View Full Caption NYPD 
LOWER EAST SIDE â€” A man tried to rape a woman after following her into her building early Friday morning, police said. 
The suspect trailed his victim into a building near Norfolk and Rivington streets at about 12:20 a.m. He followed her up a flight of stairs and then shoved her through the door of her apartment and groped her, according to the NYPD . 
He then tried to remove her clothes, but the woman fought him off and the man fled, authorities said. 
Police released a surveillance video Friday afternoon showing the suspect walking on a street. 
He is described as being about 28 to 34 years old, standing 5-foot-10 and weighing roughly 170 pounds, police said. He was last seen wearing a brown waist-length jacket and black jeans. 
Anyone with information is asked to call the NYPD's Crime Stoppers Hotline at 1-800-577-TIPS (8477) or for Spanish, 1-888-57-PISTA (74782). You can also submit their tips by logging onto the Crime stoppers website at www.nypdcrimestoppers.com .
